LOTS OF BOTS
Developed By Lane Smith

As a new & learning developer, one of the initial tasks I undertook was to create automated bots for Discod, a platform that I utilize on a daily basis. Many of these bots utilize the Chat-GPT REST API fom OpenAI. The Chat-GPT API allows the desired trigger & response format as well as pesonality logic to be built right into the POST request. Other bots leverage existing REST APIs that return data, random quotes in this instance, from a database when tiggered. At present, my focus is on developing my own REST APIs as well as formating my own databases. Managing my own APIs will enable me to enhance the functionality of my bots in the future.

Code-Buddy: A Virtual Code Inteview

I made Code-Buddy to help me get ready for coding job interviews. This Bot will give random questions and code challenges based on what you want to practice and how difficult you want it to be. After you try to solve the challenge, Code-Buddy gives you the answer and explains how to solve it. It even gives you links to places where you can learn more. To use Code-Buddy, just tell it what subject you want to practice, like "React" or "Javascript," and how hard you want the question to be, like "1/10" or "7/10." Then Code-Buddy gives you a random question. If you want the answer and a detailed explanation, you just type "answer" after the question is given.

See Code Invite Bot
